title: CLARITY Common Dictionary
description: CLARITY Common Dictionary is a respository of reusable components/types for specifying the Data Package and Resource properties.

profile.title: Profile
profile.context: Every Package and Resource descriptor has a profile. The default profile, if none is declared, is `clarity-data-package` for Package and `clarity-data-resource` for Resource.

name.title: Name
name.description: An identifier string. Lower case characters with `.`, `_`, `-` and `/` are allowed.
name.context: This is ideally a url-usable and human-readable name. Name `SHOULD` be invariant, meaning it `SHOULD NOT` change when its parent descriptor is updated.

id.title: ID
id.description: A property reserved for globally unique identifiers. Examples of identifiers that are unique include UUIDs and DOIs.
id.context: A common usage pattern for Data Packages is as a packaging format within the bounds of a system or platform. In these cases, a unique identifier for a package is desired for common data handling workflows, such as updating an existing package. While at the level of the specification, global uniqueness cannot be validated, consumers using the `id` property `MUST` ensure identifiers are globally unique.

description.title: Description
description.description: A text description. Markdown is encouraged.

homepage.title: Home Page
homepage.description: The home on the web that is related to this data package.

date.title: Date
date.context: The date must conform to the string formats for datetime as described in [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

datetime.title: DateTime
datetime.context: The datetime must conform to the string formats for datetime as described in [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

path.title: Path
path.description: A fully qualified URL, or a POSIX file path..
path.context: Implementations need to negotiate the type of path provided, and dereference the data accordingly.

contributor.title: Contributor

organisation.title: Organisation
organisation.description: An organisational affiliation for this contributor.

role.title: Role
role.description: Role of the person contributing to this descriptor.

contributor.context: Use of this property does not imply that the person was the original creator of, or a contributor to, the data in the descriptor, but refers to the composition of the descriptor itself.

license.title: License

name.title: Open Definition license identifier
name.description: MUST be an Open Definition license identifier, see http://licenses.opendefinition.org/

license.context: Use of this property does not imply that the person was the original creator of, or a contributor to, the data in the descriptor, but refers to the composition of the descriptor itself.

licenses.title: Licenses
licenses.description: The license(s) under which this package/resource is published.
licenses.context: This property is not legally binding and does not guarantee that the package/resource is licensed under the terms defined herein.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: The raw sources for this data package/resource.

countryCode.title: ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 Country code
countryCode.description: A valid 2-digit ISO country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2), or, an array of valid ISO codes.

language.title: Language
language.description: ISO/TS 19139 alpha-3 (three lower-case characters) code denoting the language in which the textual information of the data package metadata is presented.
language.context: If empty, it is assumed English (`eng`)

spatialExtent.title: Spatial Extent
spatialExtent.description: The minimum spatial envelop that contains the contents of this data package/resource.

xmin.title: XMin
xmin.description: Minimum coordinate value in the "x" axis that defines the spatial extent.

xmax.title: XMax
xmax.description: Maximum coordinate value in the "x" axis that defines the spatial extent.

ymin.title: YMin
ymin.description: Minimum coordinate value in the "y" axis that defines the spatial extent.

ymax.title: YMax
ymax.description: Maximum coordinate value in the "y" axis that defines the spatial extent.

spatialExtent.context:
This property is MANDATORY if the datapackage contains at least one geo-resource.

With the existence of this property in the datapackage, a program can easily make a geospatial query for finding datapackages containing resources that at contained in the requested bbox (instead of having to check resource by resource).

temporalExtent.description:
Start and end of the temporal range for the contents of this data package/resource.

The temporal reference system in which start and end datetime values are encoded is ISO 8601:2004

start.title: Start
start.description: A string describing the start of the temporal interval for the contents of this data package/resource.

end.title: End
end.description: A string describing the end of the temporal interval  for the contents of this data package/resource.

referencePeriods.title: Reference Periods
referencePeriods.description: The temporal reference property indicates all the years (or dates) for the information present in the dataset. Values are according to the default temporal referece system ISO 8601:2004

spatialResolutionByDistance.title: Spatial Resolution (Distance)
spatialResolutionByDistance.description: Spatial resolution described in terms of "distance". A resolution distance shall be expressed as a numerical value associated with a unit of length. Use degree values if the projection is geographic, otherwise use meters

distance.title: Distance
distance.description:
Numerical value expressing the distance.

Default grid resolution for CLARITY datasets is 500m

uom.description: The units of measurement used to define the distance. By default, in meters (m).

spatialResolutionByScale.title: Spatial Resolution (Distance)
spatialResolutionByScale.description: Spatial resolution described in terms of "scale". An equivalent scale is generally expressed as an integer value expressing the scale denominator.

scale.description: Integer value expressing the scale denominator.

spatialResolution.title: Spatial Resolution
spatialResolution.description: Spatial resolution refers to the level of detail of the data set. It shall be expressed as a set of zero to many resolution distances (typically for gridded data and imagery-derived products) or equivalent scales (typically for maps or map-derived product.
spatialResolution.context:
Note 1: An equivalent scale is generally expressed as an integer value expressing the scale denominator. A resolution distance shall be expressed as a numerical value associated with a unit of length.

Note 2: For grids it is assumed that the resolution of the cells is the same in the x and y axes.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Pointer to metadata record providing further information about this data package/resource
metadata.context: Typically, the metadata record will be located in a metadata catalogue (e.g., OGC Catalog or CKAN catalogue)

band_count.title: Band Count
band_count.description: Number of bands contained in the gridded dataset. If absent, it is assumed that the raster has only one band

columns.title: Columns
columns.description: This property indicates the number of columns in the grid

rows.title: Rows
rows.description: This property indicates the number of rows in the grid

start_cell.title: Start Cell
start_cell.description:
This property indicates the starting cell of the raster.
Possible values are: top-left, bottom-right

bands.title: Bands
bands.description: List of bands that compose the grid

gridBandInfo.title: Grid Band Info
gridBandInfo.description: Information about a specific band contained in the grid

uom.description: Unit of measurement for the information represented in this band

bit_depth.title: Bit Depth
bit_depth.description: The bit depth (also known as pixel depth) of a cell determines the range of values that a particular raster file can store, which is based on the formula 2n (where n is the bit depth). For example, an uint8 raster can have 256 unique values, which range from 0 to 255.

compression_type.title: Compression Method
compression_type.description: This property indicates compression method used to compress the information contained in the raster.

nodata.description: Value used to represent the absence of data in a cell. The value must be in relation to the ranges used with the bit_depth property

uom.description: Unit of measurement of the parameter

eu-gl.title: EU-GL Module
eu-gl.description: List of possible EU-GL module(s) the resource is applicable to.

hazardType.title: Hazard Type
hazardType.description: List of possible hazard type(s) the resource is related to.

hazardTypeIndex.title: Hazard Type Index
hazardTypeIndex.description: List of possible hazard type index the resource is related to.

elementAtRisk.title: Element at Risk
elementAtRisk.description: List of possible element(s) at risk referring to the resource

vulnerabilityClass.title: Vulnerability Class
vulnerabilityClass.description: List of possible vulnerability class(es) related to the element(s) at risk referring to the resource

damageClass.title: Damage Class
damageClass.description: List of possible damage class(es) related to the element(s) at risk referring to the resource

emissionsScenario.title: Emissions Scenarios
emissionsScenario.description: List of possible emissions scenarios referring to the resource

hazardEvent.title: Hazard Event
hazardEvent.description: List of possible hazard events (for the impact scenarios) referring to the resource

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: A reference to some related stuff concerning the resource or data package
reference.context:
Currently, these are the references types defined, although nothing prevents the definition of new ones by others:
 * @mapview 
 * @metadata 
 * @tag 
 * @resource 
 * @tableview 
 * css: The css_style property is a pointer to a default CSS file containing the styling configuration for several elements within the data package (e.g., threholds values colouring, vector and raster maps colouring, etc.).

Please, check the following links for further information:
# https://www.w3.org/TR/css-2018/ 
# https://docs.geoserver.org/latest/en/user/styling/css/cookbook/index.html
